summary: Max Lesnick was a Cuban exile involved in anti-Castro activities. The documents suggest he had connections to other Cuban exiles and groups, including Aldo Vera. One document mentions his potential connections to terrorist activities. He is associated with activities in PBRUMEN (likely Cuba) and is mentioned in the context of travel plans and contacts related to AMBANG-1. The documents span from 1965 to 1979, indicating his involvement in anti-Castro efforts over a significant period.
significance: While the documents do not explicitly link Max Lesnick to the JFK assassination, his association with Cuban exile groups and potential terrorist connections, as well as his involvement in anti-Castro activities, places him within the broader context of individuals and groups who may have had motives to oppose or undermine the Kennedy administration. The documents suggest potential connections to individuals and groups of interest in the JFK assassination investigation.
